title: 'PM Modi asked Putin about Ukraine plan after US tariff hit': Nato chief's big claim
content: Nato chief Mark Rutte supported Donald Trump's tariffs on India, asserting they pressure Russia over the Ukraine war. Rutte highlighted Modi's concerns to Putin due to the tariffs and Trump's commitment to his policies. He noted Russia's weakened position, citing significant losses and economic strains, while emphasizing Zelensky's role in any territorial negotiations.

title: Reducing Russian crude: India wants US to allow oil from Iran
content: Indian representatives have told the Trump administration that significant cuts in Russian oil imports would require access to alternative crude from sanctioned nations like Iran and Venezuela. During discussions in the US, the Indian delegation reiterated concerns that blocking access to oil from these producers could trigger global price increases.

title: Maoists allege 'fake encounter'; claim police arrested CC members, then killed them
content: Following a reported encounter in Abujhmarh forest, a dispute has erupted between Chhattisgarh police and the CPI (Maoist). The police claim to have killed two central committee members, but the Maoist outfit alleges a "fake encounter," asserting that the commanders were arrested beforehand. Police refuted the allegations, suggesting the Maoist statement is a reaction to check police response.

title: UP doctors remove 29 spoons, 19 toothbrushes, 2 pens from man’s stomach
content: Surgeons in Hapur were astonished to discover 29 steel spoons, 19 toothbrushes, and two pens inside a 40-year-old man's stomach during an emergency surgery. The patient, admitted to a Ghaziabad de-addiction center, complained of severe abdominal pain.

title: 'Paper chor': Rahul's new attack after 'vote chori' charge; points to exam leaks
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the BJP government of being a "paper chor" amid rising outrage over examination leaks, particularly the UKSSSC paper leak in Uttarakhand. He linked the issue to his earlier allegations of "vote chori," arguing that unemployment and electoral malpractice are connected. Gandhi declared his support for protesting students, calling the crisis a fight for justice and democracy.

title: WFH won’t win: Google ex-CEO slams remote working; says he’s not in favour of it
content: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt reignites the remote work debate. He argues flexible work hurts tech competitiveness. Schmidt believes it hinders learning, especially for young professionals. He contrasts US work culture with China's intense work ethic. Schmidt previously criticized Google's flexible approach. He also warns the US could lose the AI race to China. He highlights China's focus on AI application.

title: War of words! Kaif responds to Bumrah: 'Take it as an observation'
content: A debate sparked between Mohammad Kaif and Jasprit Bumrah after Kaif questioned Bumrah's workload management during the Asia Cup, particularly under Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy. Bumrah sharply refuted Kaif's observations on social media. Kaif responded calmly, framing his remarks as a well-wisher's perspective, emphasizing Bumrah's crucial role for India, particularly in high-profile games.

title: India-US trade pact: Big update on Goyal's visit; aim for 'early conclusion'
content: India and the US are committed to progressing towards a trade agreement, as stated by the Ministry of Commerce & Industry. During Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's visit to the US, both sides discussed potential aspects of the deal and agreed to continue discussions for a mutually beneficial outcome.

title: Dentures ‘your fault’: What US authorities told 73-year old grandma when she refused ice
content: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who lived in the US for 30 years, faced deportation after her asylum applications were denied. During her detention, she was allegedly denied proper medical care, food, and basic hygiene.

title: H-1B fee hike: Why US workers were replaced by foreigners; senators ask tech giants
content: US lawmakers, led by Senators Grassley and Durbin, are questioning major companies like Amazon, Apple, and JPMorgan about their H-1B hiring practices amidst job cuts. They demand data on H-1B worker numbers, wages, and potential displacement of American workers. This scrutiny follows the Trump administration's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, which the US Chamber of Commerce may challenge in court.

title: Teenager flees home abuse in UP, survives gang rape in Jaipur
content: A 15-year-old girl, fleeing abuse in Uttar Pradesh, endured gang rape in Jaipur, leading to the tragic delivery of a stillborn child. After escaping her stepfather's torment in Gorakhpur, she met Krishna in Ajmer, who brought her to Jaipur and allegedly assaulted her. Later, Krishna's friend, Bacchan, also repeatedly raped her.

title: No relief for Rahul: HC junks plea in Sikh row; Varanasi court to hear case
content: Rahul Gandhi's revision petition against a Varanasi MP/MLA Special Court order has been dismissed by the Allahabad High Court. The petition challenged the Special Court's acceptance of a complaint filed against him regarding remarks he made about Sikhs during a visit to the United States in September 2024. This legal challenge stems from the aftermath of his comments made abroad.

title: 'Dangerous alien': US arrests another 'illegal' Indian for multi-vehicle crash
content: Partap Singh, an undocumented Indian, was arrested after a multi-vehicle crash. The crash critically injured a five-year-old girl and her father. Homeland Security criticized California Governor Gavin Newsom for issuing Singh a commercial driver’s license. This is the second such case this year. Earlier, Harjinder Singh was charged with vehicular homicide in Florida.

title: Top H‑1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others - check list
content: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.

title: Nia Jax reveals why she hid her family ties from WWE officials
content: Nia Jax, cousin of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, initially concealed her Anoa’i family ties upon entering WWE. She aimed to prove her worth independently, participating in the first tryout at the NXT Performance Center. Jax has since become a prominent WWE performer, securing championships and earning respect for her perseverance, marking a unique journey built on her own merits.

title: Heart disease & leg pain: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD) symptoms explained
content: Leg pain during walking could signal Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD), indicating clogged arteries and increased risk of heart attack and stroke. Early detection through tests like ABI is crucial, especially for those with risk factors such as smoking or diabetes. Addressing PAD through lifestyle changes and medical interventions can protect both legs and heart.

title: Watch: Man runs over ex-girlfriend with speeding scooter in Indore
content: In Indore's Heera Nagar, Rajendra Chaurasia allegedly ran over his ex-girlfriend with an Activa after she refused to reconcile. The incident occurred in Kalpana Nagar, following an argument where Rajendra insisted they live together. CCTV footage captured him speeding towards her, even as she tried to defend herself.

title: Martina Navratilova sparks row over Melania Trump’s viral look at Donald Trump
content: Martina Navratilova ignited controversy by commenting on Melania Trump's expression during the UN General Assembly in New York, suggesting she despises her husband. This followed Navratilova's criticism of Donald Trump's behavior at the US Open final, where she noted his lack of applause and the security delays caused by his presence, further highlighting her outspoken opposition to the former president.

title: Bangladesh paid the price vs Pakistan, will India regret catches dropped next?
content: Dropped catches proved costly for Bangladesh as Pakistan secured a spot in the Asia Cup final against India. Phil Simmons, Bangladesh coach, lamented the missed opportunities and poor batting decisions that led to their 11-run defeat. India's fielding has also been a concern, with 12 dropped catches in five matches.

title: 'Mark my words': Akhtar tells Pakistan how to beat India in Asia Cup final
content: Shoaib Akhtar believes Pakistan can defeat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final by dismissing Abhishek Sharma early and maintaining an aggressive mindset. Akhtar emphasized the importance of targeting Sharma in the initial overs, suggesting that his early dismissal could destabilize the Indian batting lineup. He also anticipates Gautam Gambhir will motivate India to bring their best game against Pakistan.

title: 'Averted catastrophe': Pakistan PM hails Trump as ‘man of peace'
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif lauded Donald Trump as a "man of peace" for his role in facilitating a ceasefire between Pakistan and India, averting a potential catastrophe in South Asia. Sharif expressed deep admiration for Trump's efforts to end global conflicts and invited him to visit Pakistan.

title: Dhanteras 2025 Shubh Muhurat: When is the most auspicious time to buy Gold in UAE?
content: Indians in the UAE are gearing up for auspicious gold purchases with Pushya Nakshatra on October 14-15 and Dhanteras on October 18-19, 2025. Pushya Nakshatra, linked to Goddess Lakshmi, offers a 20-hour window for buying gold. Dhanteras extends the Muhurat for over 19 hours, favoring gold, silver, and utensil acquisitions.

title: PM Modi sends Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women in Bihar; details about the scheme
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana in Bihar, transferring ₹10,000 to 75 lakh women. The ₹7,500 crore scheme aims to empower women through self-employment, offering additional financial support up to ₹2 lakh for entrepreneurial ventures. Beneficiaries can use the funds for agriculture, handicrafts, and other small enterprises, fostering economic independence and development in the state.

title: 'Tests your nerves': Praggnanandhaa plays jenga with friends to unwind - watch video
content: Indian chess prodigy R Praggnanandhaa, fresh off his Sinquefield Cup performance and Tata Masters win, unwinds by playing Jenga, showcasing his ability to balance focus and relaxation. His recent achievements, including a rivalry with D. Gukesh, highlight India's growing chess prominence.

title: Trump’s 100% tariffs: Which Indian pharma stocks are most vulnerable? Explained
content: Donald Trump's tariff move impacts Indian pharma stocks. Companies like Sun Pharma, Cipla, and Dr. Reddy's face potential declines. US represents a major market for Indian exports.

title: Centre cancels FCRA licence of Wangchuk's NGO
content: The Union home ministry has cancelled the FCRA license of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO, Students Educational and Cultural Movement of Ladakh, citing alleged violations. These violations include depositing locally generated funds into the FCRA account, diverting funds for impermissible activities like studying the country's sovereignty, and failing to deposit foreign funds in the designated account.

title: Odd flight path: Why did Israeli PM Netanyahu’s plane skirt Europe?
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's flight to the UN General Assembly took a circuitous route, avoiding several European nations possibly due to outstanding arrest warrants issued by the ICC for alleged war crimes. This comes as several European countries have recently recognized Palestinian statehood, a move strongly opposed by Netanyahu.

title: Rat bites IT pro waiting at Indore airport
content: Following a rat bite incident in the departure hall, Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar airport took swift action. The airport replaced the on-duty doctor due to a lack of sensitivity and imposed fines on both the pest control and sanitation agencies. Furthermore, the pest control frequency has been increased to every alternate day to prevent future occurrences.

title: 'Make him CM': Ajit Pawar loses cool — chides flood-hit farmer over loan waiver question
content: During a visit to Maharashtra's flood-hit Marathwada, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar faced farmers' demands for loan waivers. Pawar, visibly frustrated, responded sharply, highlighting existing welfare schemes like Ladki Bahin and electricity bill waivers.

title: Anti-Hindi showdown in Bengaluru: Protesters storm MHA promotional event attended by MPs
content: In Bengaluru, 41 members of a pro-Kannada group were arrested. They disrupted a Hindi Diwas meeting at a five-star hotel. The meeting was organised by the ministry of home affairs. The protestors barged into the venue and raised slogans. They opposed the promotion of Hindi. The police detained the protestors and restored order.

title: A sentinel of skies: After 62 years in service, IAF bids farewell to MiG-21
content: After 62 years of service, the Indian Air Force bid farewell to the MiG-21, a Soviet-origin supersonic jet that played a crucial role in several conflicts, including the 1965 and 1971 wars, the Kargil war, and the Balakot strikes. Air Chief Marshal A P Singh flew the last sortie of the MiG-21 Bison aircraft. The final operations were carried out by the number 23 Squadron, nicknamed "Panthers."

title: 'Pata chal raha hai': Pathan roasts Pak's fielding after missed run out
content: Pakistan clinched a spot in the Asia Cup 2025 final by defeating Bangladesh by 11 runs in a Super Four match, despite facing batting challenges and fielding errors. Salman Ali Agha's team will now face India in the final on September 28. Irfan Pathan criticised Pakistan's fielding mishap during the match, highlighting a missed run-out opportunity.

title: Delhi molestation: 'Godman' files anticipatory bail plea
content: The Patiala House Court has reserved its order on the anticipatory bail plea of Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati. Delhi Police opposed the bail, stating that the accused has been on the run. He is accused of illegally withdrawing Rs 60 lakh and possessing two passports. He also faces allegations of sexual harassment and misconduct.

title: Bengaluru woman slapped, kicked, dragged on floor 'for stealing sari'
content: In Bengaluru, a textile shop owner, Umed Ram, and his employee, Mahendra Seervi, were arrested after a video surfaced showing them assaulting Hampamma, a 55-year-old woman, for allegedly stealing sarees. Ram accused Hampamma of stealing 61 sarees worth Rs 91,500. The video, recorded by onlookers, prompted police action after going viral.

title: 'Unfortunate': Pakistan 'boycotts' World Para-Athletics in India
content: Pakistan has boycotted the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi, citing security concerns and heightened political tensions following the Pahalgam attack and subsequent Indian air strikes. The National Paralympic Committee of Pakistan (NPCP) withdrew its sole athlete, Haider Ali, despite his qualification. World Para Athletics expressed disappointment, noting other athletes compete despite political conflicts.

title: Nasa-Isro's NISAR sends first radar images of Earth's surface
content: NASA and ISRO's joint NISAR satellite, launched in July 2025, has released its first radar images, showcasing Earth's surface in remarkable detail. The dual-band radar system provides unprecedented insight into forests, wetlands, farmland, and urban areas. These images highlight NISAR's potential for monitoring ecosystems, agriculture, and natural disasters.

title: 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' row: HC questions maintainability of Sameer Wankhede's plea
content: The Delhi High Court questioned the maintainability of Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against Shahrukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment and Netflix, concerning the series 'The Ba***rds of Bollywood'. Wankhede alleges the series harms his reputation and seeks damages. The court granted Wankhede time to amend his application, arguing the series is streamed in Delhi, causing defamation there.

title: On 80-yr-old's plea, SC orders eviction of his 61-yr-old son
content: The Supreme Court intervened in a poignant case, ordering a 61-year-old man to vacate his elderly parents' Mumbai properties. The octogenarian couple sought relief under the Maintenance and Welfare of Senior Citizens Act after their son failed to provide mandated support.

title: 40 minor girls found locked in toilet of illegal madrassa in UP
content: In Bahraich, authorities raided an illegal madrassa following local complaints, discovering forty minor girls confined in a bathroom. The operator, Khalil Ahmad, fled, while his daughter claimed it was a coaching center. Locals are suspicious of Ahmad's wealth and are demanding a thorough investigation, potentially involving the Enforcement Directorate, due to concerns about illegal activities.

title: ‘Knows better than anybody’: Trump’s veiled jibe at Erdogan over ‘rigged elections’ - watch
content: In a recent White House meeting, Donald Trump and Recep Tayyip Erdogan discussed reviving US-Turkey ties amidst geopolitical tensions. Trump playfully alluded to Erdogan's familiarity with 'rigged elections.' Key agenda points included Turkey's F-35 fighter jet program reinstatement and collaborative efforts to resolve the Gaza conflict.

title: Manmohan Singh’s 93rd birth anniversary: PM Modi pays tribute; recalls his contributions
content: Narendra Modi honored Manmohan Singh on his 93rd birth anniversary. Modi acknowledged Singh's service to the nation. Singh served as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014. He is known for economic reforms as finance minister. Singh represented Assam in Rajya Sabha for three decades. Leaders remembered his role in shaping India's economy. He passed away on December 26, 2024.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for September 26?
content: Gold price prediction today: Jateen Trivedi of LKP Securities suggests a sell-on-rise strategy for gold, citing technical indicators signaling weakness. Gold futures face selling pressure amid cautious global markets and US economic data anticipation.

title: In dire need of runs: Surya's poor form a big concern for India in Asia Cup
content: Team India captain Suryakumar Yadav is in the middle of an unusual patch of form. In the last nine innings, he has mustered only 87 runs with an abysmal average of 12.42 and a strike rate of 112.98. In this Asia Cup, Surya has managed only 59 runs in four innings.

title: 100% on pharma products, 50% on kitchen cabinets: Trump rolls out new round of tariffs
content: Donald Trump announced significant tariffs on various goods, effective October 1st, 2025. A 100% tariff will be imposed on branded pharmaceuticals unless companies begin manufacturing in the US. Additionally, tariffs of 50% on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, 30% on upholstered furniture, and 25% on heavy trucks aim to protect domestic industries.

title: Dulquer Salmaan moves Kerala High Court, challenges Customs seizure of high-end car
content: A Land Rover was seized from Dulquer Salmaan’s house in Kochi as part of crackdown on celebrities who reportedly purchased 36 high-end used cars from Bhutan using forged documents

title: Need personal and professional integrity, transparency, adherence to rules: Neeraj Kumar Dohare, Sr. DGM of Central Railway
content: A seminar ‘Vigilance: Our Shared Responsibility’ was organised as part of preparations for Vigilance Awareness Week starting October 27.

title: Supreme Court defers Vodafone Idea plea against extra AGR demand to October 6
content: A Bench headed by CJI B.R. Gavai agreed to an oral request made by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for DoT, to defer the hearing to October 6

title: In pictures | MiG-21 flies one last time
content: After over six decades in service, the Indian Air Force is formally retiring its last MiG-21 Bison jets.

title: Telangana ranks first in rainwater harvesting; 5.20 lakh works taken up in 2024-25
content: The rainwater harvesting initiative was spearheaded by Panchayat Raj and Rural Development Department with support from multiple departments, voluntary organisations and individuals

title: Allahabad HC junks Rahul Gandhi’s plea against Varanasi court orders on his remarks in U.S. on Sikh community
content: The order was challenged before the special MP/MLA sessions court which allowed the revision and remanded the matter to magisterial court to hear it afre

title: Madras High Court directs Sony Music to disclose revenue from ‘exploiting’ Ilaiyaraaja’s songs
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar passes the interim order on a new civil suit filed by the composer, alleging unauthorised exploitation of his songs in the digital space

title: Nitish Katara murder: Supreme Court refuses to extend interim bail of convict Vikas Yadav
content: A Bench of Justices M M Sundresh and Satish Chandra Sharma was hearing a plea filed by Mr. Yadav against the September 9 Delhi High Court interim order denying him any extension of interim bail

title: Delhi Court reserves order on pre-arrest bail plea of self-styled godman Chaitanyananda Saraswati in forgery case
content: Additional Sessions Judge Hardeep Kaur would pronounce the order either Friday (September 26) evening or on Saturday (September 27)

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer visits Kanaka Durga temple
content: Endowments Commissioner Ramachandra Mohan, Collector G. Lakshmisha and temple EO V.K. Seena Naik welcomed the Governor with temple honours

title: Government says India held ‘constructive’ meetings in the U.S., does not reveal date of next official meeting
content: Apart from meetings with the U.S. government representatives, the Indian delegation held discussions with key U.S. based businesses and investors on how to promote trade and investment between India and the U.S.

title: Karnataka rain: MP to distribute 2,500 food kits to flood-hit villagers in Kalaburagi
content: Kalaburagi Lok Sabha member Radhakrishna Doddamani said the incessant rainfall over the past week had led to overflowing of the Bhima and Bennethora rivers, forcing hundreds of villagers in low-lying areas to move to safer places

title: Kerala High Court directs government to decide on corruption probe against P.P. Divya within two months
content: The order was issued while disposing of a petition by KSU vice president Muhammad Shammas, who alleged that Vigilance probe was being sabotaged and sought a more effective investigation

title: Mysore Sandal Soap is now the fragrance partner for Kantara – Chapter 1
content: The State-owned Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited, which makes Mysore Sandal Soap, has tied with the film team as per which its products will be promoted at every screening of the film in India and 30 other countries

title: Complete ban on firecrackers doesn’t work, need balanced approach: Supreme Court
content: The Bench directed the Environment Ministry to resolve the firecracker issue after taking onboard stakeholders

title: Supreme Court directs preservation of body of top Maoist commander Katha Ramchandra Reddy killed in police encounter
content: Senior Advocate Colin Gonsalves, appearing for petitioner Raja Chandra, submitted that his father was allegedly tortured and killed in a fake encounter and the police are trying to dispose of the body

title: Karnataka socio-educational survey: Kodavas confused over how to record religious identity
content: A section of community leaders has been urging Kodavas to declare ‘Kodava’ in the caste, language, and religion columns, while another section has been appealing to continue identifying themselves under Hindu religion

title: MiG-21 added many proud moments in military aviation journey, says Rajnath Singh
content: Union Defence Minister was addressing a gathering on the occasion of the decommissioning ceremony of Russian-origin MiG-21

title: Supreme Court stays Andhra Pradesh HC order faulting CBI director over Tirupati ‘adulterated ghee’ probe
content: The Chief Justice-headed Bench passed the interim order on a plea filed by the CBI chief challenging the findings of the High Court

title: Pray to Maa Durga that 'Sonar Bangla' glory is restored by new Govt post 2026 polls: Amit Shah in Kolkata
content: The Home Minister also expressed grief over the recent rain-related deaths in the state, and conveyed condolences to the bereaved families

title: Man dies after village headman in Uttar Pradesh opens fire at his child's naming ceremony
content: The village headman, Sukhdev, arrived at the venue and began firing as he was not invited to the function

title: Ladakh protests: what do protesters want?
content: Here is what we know so far about the Ladakh protests, how the clashes in Leh unfolded, the demands driving the unrest, who is leading the movement, and what may come next.

title: ‘Jal Prahar 2025’ concludes with Indian Navy’s successful two-phase joint amphibious exercise with Army
content: Indian Navy concludes ‘Jal Prahar 2025’ joint exercise with Indian Army to enhance amphibious operations along eastern seaboard

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea seeking ban on Salman Rushdie’s novel ‘The Satanic Verses’
content: The top court refuses plea to ban Salman Rushdie’s “The Satanic Verses” citing lack of relevant notification

title: 1,000 kidney transplants and counting at Chennai’s Stanley Hospital
content: It was 29 years ago that the first renal transplant (living donor) was performed at SMCH. To date, a total of 1,006 renal transplants have been performed — 837 from live related donors and 169 from deceased donors

title: Delhi HC questions Sameer Wankhede over maintainability of defamation plea against Aryan Khan’s ‘Ba***ds of Bollywood’ series
content: Senior advocate Sandeep Sethi, representing Mr. Wankhede, said the web series is meant for across cities, including Delhi, and the officer has been defamed here

title: PM Modi launches Bihar’s employment scheme by transferring ₹10,000 each into the bank accounts of 75 lakh women
content: The Prime Minister targeted the earlier RJD government and urged everyone to pledge collectively that Bihar must never return to the darkness of the past as women in Bihar bore the brunt of lawlessness and corruption

title: Curfew remains in force for third day in Leh town
content: Police and paramilitary personnel in riot gear were seen patrolling the deserted streets to maintain law and order

title: Botanical Survey of India gets a new director, the first mycologist to head the institute
content: Kanad Das succeeds A. A. Mao as the 13th director of the BSI which was set up in 1890 and has 11 regional centers with four units headquartered in Kolkata

title: West Bengal school jobs case: Calcutta High Court grants bail to former Minister Partha Chatterjee
content: The Bench of Justice Suvra Ghosh directed Partha Chatterjee to surrender his passport and not leave the jurisdiction of the trial court, as conditions of the jail

title: MiG-21 flies through Indian skies for last time, Rajnath Singh terms it ‘national pride’
content: The last of the MiG-21 jets, belonging to number 23 Squadron, nicknamed "Panthers" are being given a farewell at the decommissioning ceremony at the Chandigarh Air Force station

title: Chhattisgarh High Court asks CBI to resume probe in five year old case of embezzlement
content: A PIL filed by Kundan Singh Thakur in 2018 alleging a large-scale misappropriation of funds at the State Resource Centre and Physical Referral Rehabilitation Centre, 2 government-run institutions set up for the welfare of PwDs

title: Siddalinga Swami to approach High Court of Karnataka seeking action against district authorities, sand panel
content: The seer has said that the district administration and the sand monitoring committee have failed to take action in illegal sand mining case

title: 'Weight lifted': Tigers top Guardians, tie for 1st
content: Detroit snapped an eight-game losing streak, beating Cleveland to move back into a tie with the Guardians atop the American League Central with three games to play.

title: Seahawks sing Darnold's praises after GW drive
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald raved about Sam Darnold's poise after the quarterback led the team down the field for a game-winning field goal Thursday night against the Cardinals.

title: Lakers leave future up to LeBron, extend Redick
content: While LeBron James enters his eighth season with the Lakers in a contract year, coach JJ Redick's future with the team is clear after being signed to an extension.

title: Lindor makes history as Mets make playoff push
content: Francisco Lindor reached the 30-30 mark for the second time in his career when he homered as the Mets captured a big series win over the Cubs.

title: Bryson-Thomas to lead off U.S. team at Ryder Cup
content: Bryson DeChambeau and Justin Thomas will be paired in the the first match of foursomes (alternate-shot) at the Ryder Cup on Friday at Bethpage Black as captains for the respective teams unveiled their morning groups.

title: Cards' Harrison flops early, lights up 4th with TD
content: Cardinals receiver Marvin Harrison took a knee to celebrate his late touchdown catch, the highlight of an up-and-down Thursday night in which he was the target on both of Kyler Murray's interceptions.

title: L. Paul sues auction house over MJ-signed court
content: Logan Paul has filed an injunction against Heritage Auctions, saying he was not allowed to investigate the authenticity of a Michael Jordan-signed piece of United Center floor that Paul won at auction.

title: Raleigh meets fan who gave 60th HR ball to boy
content: The fan who gave a 12-year-old boy Cal Raleigh's 60th home run ball Wednesday night in Seattle returned to T-Mobile Park on Thursday and was gifted a signed Raleigh bat and two baseball -- which he gave to his kids.

title: 🏈 Fantasy playbook: Shadow Report, lineup locks
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: The final days of the regular season are upon us -- and the wild-card races are coming down to the wire.

title: 'Beyond my wildest dreams': Keegan Bradley's journey from the slopes in Vermont to Ryder Cup captain
content: Keegan Bradley was never on the fast path to golf stardom. He grew up in New England and had to fight his way to the top of the game, where he finds himself this week at Bethpage Black.

title: Six NFL teams are 0-3: What's the problem, and what to expect
content: The Giants are going with Jaxson Dart at QB as history shows the difference between 1-3 and 0-4 is drastic for playoff hopes.

content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, and Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta.

content: The biggest trade in WNBA history happened last February. Now a player involved in that deal will win a WNBA title.

content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

content: Big conference matchups, quarterbacks that are making a name for themselves and more ahead of Week 5.

content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: Which major NFL trades look better -- or worse -- in hindsight? Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent swaps
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: What it's like for former Cowboys stars -- such as Micah, Emmitt, DeMarcus, Zeke -- to return to Dallas as an opponent
content: Micah Parsons will follow in the footsteps of Emmitt Smith, DeMarcus Ware and Ezekiel Elliott on Sunday as an opponent at AT&T Stadium.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Why clubs shouldn't freeze players out, like Chelsea are doing with Raheem Sterling
content: The trend of players having to train away from the first team -- like Chelsea's Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi -- is a reminder that clubs hold an unfair amount of leverage.

title: Will Tessmann leapfrog McKennie, Musah to start for USMNT at 2026 World Cup?
content: Tanner Tessmann hasn't represented the U.S. since March, but he has been so good at Lyon in 2025-26 that Mauricio Pochettino can't keep ignoring him.

title: Lost seasons, disastrous drafts and fans rooting for the visiting team: Inside the Rockies' road to rock bottom
content: As Colorado nears the finish of one of the worst seasons in MLB history. Here's why the decline was a long time coming.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool look to Bayern's Upamecano
content: Liverpool are lining up a move for Bayern Munich center back Dayot Upamecano. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: Alonso's first F1 title, 20 years later: 'He was just another level'
content: Twenty years after winning his first F1 championship, Fernando Alonso is still on the grid, still revered, and still hungry for another world title.

title: West Virginia, Boise State lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965, while Boise State is making waves with incredibly detailed, hand-painted helmets.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Battle for No. 1: Draisaitl, Pastrnak and the players to consider
content: Six players have a chance at being the No. 1 pick in fantasy hockey drafts, and we look at each one is deserving.

title: Kerala rains: IMD sounds orange alert for four districts
content: Orange alert for Thiruvananthapuram, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam and Idukki districts, while Kollam, Alappuzha, Ernakulam, Thrissur and Palakkad are on yellow alert on Friday

title: Accessibility and Durga Pujas: How accessible are pandals in Kolkata
content: From accessibility plans to multiple awards, Durga Pujas in Kolkata are taking various initiatives to bring inclusivity into the festivities

title: Three IndiGo flights bound for Hyderabad diverted to Vijayawada due to poor visibility
content: Flight disruptions at Hyderabad airport due to heavy rain, IndiGo flights diverted to Vijayawada, travel advisory issued by airline

title: Visakhapatnam’s anti-encroachment drive | Caught between changing cityscape and shattered livelihoods
content: ‘Operation Lungs 2.0’ initiative aimed at streamlining street vending system and restoring public spaces in Visakhapatnam has been tagged as a “drive snatching away livelihoods in the name of urban beautification”

title: Tribal groups oppose Assam-Meghalaya hydropower project
content: The two State governments are jointly pursuing the 55 MW project on the Kulsi River, a natural habitat of the endangered Gangetic river dolphin

title: The slowly dying American dream
content: For decades, Hyderabad’s Ameerpet buzzed with a singular dream: study hard, land in the United States and secure a top job. But on September 19, President Donald Trump’s H-1B visa rule shake-up upended that aspiration with steep new costs and restrictions, forcing families and students to rethink futures, investments and even travel plans. At a time when COVID, AI, and automation are already rewriting careers, the promise of America suddenly feels distant and uncertain

title: Cauvery Aarti: Entry fee, vehicle toll for Brindavan Gardens waived, free laddoos for visitors
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar will inaugurate the Cauvery Aarti, which comprises traditional rituals, by offering flowers to Cauvery river as per the rituals

title: World requires global workforce, can’t escape this reality, says Jaishankar
content: The External Affairs Minister called for the creation of a more acceptable, contemporary, efficient model of a global workforce, which can then be located in a distributed, global workplace

title: Yamuna water quality improves, as flood waters flush out pollutants
content: Despite the improvement in September, the water quality did not meet bathing standards at most of the points along the stretch, where water was tested

title: Odisha puts districts on high alert for heavy rain as low-pressure area forms over Bay of Bengal
content: Instructions regarding it were issued to the district collectors through a video conference by Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) Deoranjan Kumar Singh

title: India sends fresh aid to quake-hit Afghanistan, relief reaches Kabul via Chabahar
content: On September 1, 2025, the Indian mission in Kabul sent truck loads of relief materials to the disaster-hit region of Kunar

title: Of men and their flying machines: Pilots hail legacy as MiG-21 prepares for swansong
content: The last of the MiG-21 jets, belonging to Squadron No. 23 and nicknamed "Panthers", will be given a farewell at the ceremony to be held at the Chandigarh Air Force station

title: Counting of votes for Assam’s BTC election begins
content: The Pramod Boro-led United People’s Party Liberal hopes to retain power on its own or in alliance with existing or new political entities

title: The right to be cool in a sweltering Global South
content: Access to air conditioning is currently severely limited in developing countries, including in India. Enhancing this access is urgently required as a public health safeguard and a necessity for adaptation to climate change. Cooling is no longer a matter of comfort for the Global South, but a frontline adaptation need

title: Citizens, domicile, and migrants: Why we should worry about Provincial Citizenship
content: Provincial citizenship emerges from nativist politics rooted in an emotional belonging to a State, which gains immediate leverage in regional electoral politics. It challenges the idea of singular Indian citizenship, sparking debates over definitions of ‘native’, ‘indigenous’, ‘Adivasi’, ‘local’, or ‘son of the soil’

title: Telangana CM to hand over Group-I appointment orders on September 27
content: Chief Secretary K. Ramakrishna Rao reviewed the arrangements in a tele-conference with senior officials

title: ED questions actor Jagapati Babu in Sahiti Infra fraud probe
content: The ED collected details of the remuneration and payment methods received by the actor for appearing in promotional campaigns of Sahiti Infra

title: HMR Phase 1 handover likely next year as L&T’s 15-year Metro journey nears end
content: Despite financial losses, L&TMRH is credited with running a tight and efficient operation, maintaining clean infrastructure, minimal breakdowns, and high service frequency

title: Counting on change: Karnataka’s long overdue survey of gender minorities
content: The Karnataka government’s survey of gender minorities, which commenced on September 15 across all 31 districts, has given hope to a large community that has been pushed to the shadows for long. Community members tell The Hindu that it shows the way forward, despite some concerns

title: Rains LIVE: Andhra Pradesh braces for heavy rain, winds; Minister orders preparedness
content: The Southwest monsoon is not expected to withdraw from Maharashtra before October 5 due to the low-pressure system

title: IMD issues orange alert for eight districts in Kerala
content: The District Collector of Thiruvananthapuram declared a holiday for educational institutions, including professional colleges, in the district and IMD cautioned fishers from putting their boats out to sea

title: Ladakh violence: J&K CM Abdullah defends Congress, accuses BJP of blaming others for its failures
content: Mr. Abdullah said the Lieutenant Governor-led Ladakh administration should see why it failed in the first place to take necessary measures to maintain peace

title: Rajasthan man arrested on charges of espionage for Pakistan in Jaisalmer
content: Rajasthan CID Intelligence arrests Hanif Khan, a suspected Pakistani spy, for allegedly sharing confidential Indian Army information with Pakistan’s intelligence agency

title: The megalithic dolmens of Kodaikanal dating back to 5,000 years
content: Only less than 50% of the dolmens (megalithic structures), recorded by Reverend A. Anglade S.J. and Reverend L.V. Newton S.J., are standing in the hills. At Pethuparai, dolmens have been fenced by the Archaeological Survey of India. At Thandikudi, they are vanishing, and some have disappeared under thick vegetation. More measures are needed to preserve them

title: A rare 200-year-old Navaratri custom in which deities are taken from Tamil Nadu to Kerala
content: A few days before the Navaratri celebrations, a spectacular event takes place in Kanniyakumari district, once part of the erstwhile Travancore. Its history dates back to more than 200 years. Even today, it reminds the local people of the strong cultural bonds between Tamil Nadu and Kerala beyond political boundaries

title: The Defence Services Staff College in Wellington and its long association with soldiers
content: The Defence Services Staff College was relocated from Quetta, Pakistan, to Wellington only after Independence. But the Nilgiris had a long association with soldiers. The British opened a depot in the mountains for its regiments to convalesce in 1862

title: Terrorism ‘persistent threat’ to development, says EAM Jaishankar in G20 Foreign Ministers’ meeting
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasises the need to combat terrorism and reform multilateralism for global stability and development

title: Mohan Majhi government plans to strengthen cooperative movement in Odisha in a big way
content: Creation of unified marketing brand—under the name of either Utkal or Kalinga—to promote Odisha’s products in international markets has been mooted

title: Six arrested in Amritsar with 4 k.g. heroin, 2 pistols: Punjab Police
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that the accused persons were in touch with a Pakistan-based handler named Shah through social media, the DGP said

title: Outrage over infant deaths in Indore | In India’s cleanest city, rats in a hospital
content: Two infants died this September after rats bit them in the NICU of a government hospital in Indore, sparking outrage. However, the Madhya Pradesh government claims that the cause of death was pre-existing medical conditions. Mehul Malpani reports on the gaps in hygiene and safety standards in decades-old facilities and the overburdened public healthcare system in the State

title: Maharashtra rains: CM seeks ‘substantial’ Central assistance
content: Death toll rises to 86; Fadnavis submits a two-page memorandum to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, stating that the govt. has approved ₹2,215 crore from the SDRF, but it could be ‘inadequate’

title: On Devi Lal birth anniversary, INLD takes the fight to the Hoodas in Rohtak
content: Mr. Chautala promised to provide free electricity and double the old age pension on returning to power

title: Palestine issue not a Muslim-Jew conflict, but a humanitarian crisis: Ambassador
content: Abdullah M. Abu Shawesh addresses ‘Gaza Solidarity Conference’ organised by the Indian Union Muslim League. Recalling that India was among the first nations to recognise the State of Palestine, he says India’s solidarity with Palestine stems from a shared history

title: Aaditya Thackeray to brief the media on ‘voter fraud’ in Maharashtra
content: He confirmed that the press conferences would be similar to those conducted by Rahul Gandhi, and he would be providing information on these poll irregularities

title: Helping Gen Z percussionists find their rhythm
content: ‘Gen Z Beats’, an initiative to build a national network of young tabla artistes from Kerala, is set to begin this December under the leadership of percussionist Arjun Kaliprasad

title: In A 'FAFO' Post, Elon Musk Praises Team Trump's Indictment Of Ex-FBI Director James Comey
content: US President Donald Trump's meeting with Tesla CEO Elon Musk at conservative activist Charlie Kirk's memorial seems to have brought a thaw in icy ties between the two former buddies.

title: 75 Lakh Women Receive Rs 10,000 Each As PM Modi Launches Scheme In Bihar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched Bihar's Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana, and transferred Rs 10,000 each to the bank accounts of 75 lakh women.

title: UK's Keir Starmer Announces Plans To Launch Digital ID Scheme To Curb Illegal Immigration
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Friday announced plans to introduce free digital ID for both nationals and those residing in the country in a bid to curb illegal migration.

title: What Is 'Pulse', Sam Altman's Recently-Launched "Favourite" ChatGPT Feature
content: Pulse is a tool designed to deliver daily personalised updates based on users' interests, past chats, and connected apps.

title: What Is Haryana's Rs 5,000-Crore 'Lado Lakshmi Yojana' Launched For 20 Lakh Women
content: Under the first phase, around 20 lakh women aged 23 to 60 years from families with an annual income of up to Rs 1 lakh will receive Rs 2,100 per month.

title: Danish Airport Closes Again After New Suspected Drone Sightings
content: A sighting of a suspected drone briefly shuttered a Danish airport on Friday for the second time in a few hours.

title: Russia Offers Localisation Of Nuclear Plants In India
content: Russia has offered India cooperation in localisation of large and small nuclear power plants as part of a civil nuclear energy collaboration between the two countries, it was announced Friday.

title: BJP's "Begging Bowl" Jibe At Siddaramaiah After Wipro Declines Road Request
content: The BJP has hit out at the Congress government in Karnataka for seeking help from Wipro founder and chairman Azim Premji to fix Bengaluru's nightmarish traffic.

title: Critics Of 'Gurupooja', 'Bharat Mata' Fake Are Sabarimala Devotees: Kerala Governor
content: Kerala Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar took a swipe at the Left government in the state, saying those who criticise 'guru pooja' and 'Bharat Mata' are only "pretending to be Sabarimala devotees".

title: Library Movement Boosts Education in Nashik's Tribal Villages
content: In Nashik's remote tribal belts, where books and study spaces were once a rarity, a grassroot movement is transforming how rural children access education.

title: Who Is Shekhar Jyoti Goswami? Musician Detained In Zubeen Garg Death Case
content: Musician Shekhar Jyoti Goswami was taken into custody on Thursday in connection with the death of singer Zubeen Garg. The 52-year-old died on September 19 during a swimming incident in Singapore, where he was to attend the Northeast India Festival.

title: Pak PM Echoes Trump's Op Sindoor Ceasefire Claim At White House
content: Did Pakistan just admit the US helped it in securing a ceasefire with India during Operation Sindoor? A readout of what Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir discussed with US President Donald Trump suggests so.

title: How US' First Amendment Challenges Trump's Hate Speech Crackdown
content: Imagine a protest outside the funeral of a popular political leader, with some of the protesters celebrating the death and holding signs that say things like "God Hates the USA/Thank God for 9/11," "America is Doomed" and "Dont Pray for the USA."

title: Flights Diverted, Traffic Chaos: Heavy Rain In Hyderabad Disrupts Normal Life
content: Normal life and transport services in Hyderabad were severely impacted today as heavy rain continued to hit the city and several other districts of Telangana, leading to flight diversions and traffic congestion.

title: Million-Year-Old Skull Could Change Human Evolution Timeline: Study
content: A digital reconstruction of a million-year-old skull suggests humans may have diverged from our ancient ancestors 400,000 years earlier than previously thought and in Asia not Africa, a new study said Friday.

title: Have You Seen First Radar Images Of Earth's Surface By NASA-ISRO Satellite Yet?
content: Launched on July 30 from Andhra Pradesh's Srikharikota, the NASA-ISRO satellite tracks changes on Earth's land and ice surfaces.

title: "Unnatrual": Serena Williams Slams New York City Hotel For Cotton Plant Display
content: Tennis legend Serena Williams has criticised a New York City hotel for cotton plant decoration in its hallway.

title: Donald Trump Lifts TikTok Ban: What This Deal Means For US Users
content: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday approving a deal to transfer ownership of TikTok's US operations to American investors.

title: "I Was Begging": US Man, Slammed To Ground By Immigration Officials, Claims $50 Million
content: An elderly US man who was body slammed to the ground as immigration agents raided his Los Angeles car wash said Thursday he is lodging a $50 million damages claim against the government.

title: Toddler Dies After Falling Into Pot Of Boiling Milk In Andhra
content: A one-and-a-half-year-old girl succumbed to her burn injuries after she accidentally fell into a pot of boiling milk kept inside a school kitchen.

title: Coaches outmaneuver NFL's defenses with court ruling on arbitration
